New Records: Glenn Phillips scored 104 off 64 balls, a century in this match.
Trent Boult took 4 wickets for 13 runs in the match.
Key Match Events: New Zealand were reduced to 15/3 in the Powerplay but recovered thanks to a partnership between Glenn Phillips and Daryl Mitchell.
Sri Lanka were bundled out for 102 in 19.2 overs, with New Zealand's bowlers contributing to the win.
Pre-Game Insights: Kane Williamson won the toss and chose to bat first but New Zealand struggled initially, losing quick wickets.
The match was played at the Sydney Cricket Ground on October 29, 2022.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson praised Glenn Phillips' innings and the team's resilience.
Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka's captain, acknowledged the tough performance and the need for improvement.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand top Group 1 with 5 points after this win.
Sri Lanka's inconsistent performance continued, with key players underperforming.
Others: The match was part of the Super 12 stage of the T20 World Cup 2022.
